Maximizing temperature with non-linear specification in levels of NPS.
The average projected change of per-capita GDP in Italy at the end of the century is weakly positive under RCP 4.5.
The average projected change of per-capita GDP in Italy at the end of the century is weakly negative under RCP 8.5.
Under RCP 4.5, the end of the century real GVA per worker average loss is around 9% with 95% provincial losses in the interval 6–12%.
Under the RCP 8.5 scenario, the effect is roughly double, from an average loss of 22% (95% of provincial losses in the interval 17–30%) with bounded temperature.
The effect without a temperature boundary is a loss of 35% (95% of provincial losses in the interval 28–44%).
